column4: Hello all. I am trying to modify my system. Is there a central area where I can change the icon used for a certain program so that that icon is used every else.
/usr/share/applications/ there are some .desktop files in there that you can set the installed programs icons for etc
your other option is to change it in the Icon theme you are using but it takes more work
The 2nd option, do you mean installing an icon theme?

each icon theme has it's own links for program icons. for example /usr/share/icons/gnome/48x48/apps has named icons that you can change. but you need to do that in each size directory which is not very hard to do but takes time and is annoying.
I found the firefox in /usr/share/applications, I right-clicked and then properties, but I'm not sure how to change the icon it uses.
it's a text file. you need to edit it, look for the icon name and change it and save it.
Let's say I have a file called browser_icon.png on my desktop, and that I've opened up the desktop configuration file for firefox in /usr/share/applications, what now?
type in the full path to the icon you wish to use. Example: Icon=/home/StevenX/Desktop/browser_icon.png

after the file is saved you might need to log off and log on again to see the change (firefox icon should now have changed in the gnome menues). if it isn't showing any icon you have a typo in the .desktop file.
got it. Thanks. Can I create these .desktop files if I don't see one for a program I want?
yes. you can. The only entries that are important is Exec=, Icon=, Name, GenericName and Type= and Categories= can be nice to have but are not needed.
the three first i meant. the rest are optional.
Thank you very much. I have changed a couple of icons. i will Log off and log back in to see what has occured. Thanks1
